fields.summary: BULK EDIT: Changing all git origin urls

fields.description:
Please add support for Gitmoji https://github.com/carloscuesta/gitmoji/

1. Show emoji instead of gitmoji "shortcuts" in history
2. Help user select correct gitmoji when creating commit message when user types ":"

fields.description:
While configuring Atlassian account after Sourcetree installation , it does not accept Atlassian account credentials.

 It shows below message even after entering correct credentials,
h2. HTTP Error 401.2 - Unauthorized
h3. You are not authorized to view this page due to invalid authentication headers.

 

This is affecting many Nielsen users .. Please fix this asap

 

 

@vijayalayan.elangovan.ap@nielsen.com
fields.summary: Soucetree Account setup issue

fields.description:
When I rename remote repository alias, Sourcetree loses information about remote branches and tracking of branches. I need to refetch that repository and set correct tracking.

{{git remote rename <old> <new>}} does not do that.

This is related SRCTREEWIN-8409 because ST doesn't allow to name remote repository during clone of the repository.

This is same bug as SRCTREE-5945.
fields.summary: Renaming remote repository alias loses information about remote branches and tracking

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open the Options dialog
 # Go to the Custom Actions tab
 # Double-click an existing custom action item to open the edit dialog
 # Click the Cancel button

Result:
 * The edit dialog immediately reappears after clicking the Cancel button.

Expected:
 * The edit dialog should not reappear after clicking the Cancel button.

Note:
 * If you click the Edit button instead of double-clicking the list item in order to open custom action edit dialog, this behavior is not triggered. That is, the Cancel button does not cause the dialog to reappear if the dialog was opened by clicking the Edit button.

This GIF shows shows reproduction of the bug: [https://interworks.box.com/s/l0ar6wrgono8mcbo8a0qomrljc6dwoza]
fields.summary: Double-clicking to edit a custom action causes the dialog to appear a second time when the Cancel button is clicked
Custom Action parameters surrounded with unintended quotes

fields.description: After leaving the office for the day, I often find that SourceTree is asking for my password when I unlock my computer the next day (this would also be nice to resolve). When this happens, the Bitbucket Login screen in SourceTree shows a flashing cursor on the password field even when it doesn't have focus.  I have marked this as high priority as it is a security issue.  I have sent my password out over Slack to a group of people twice now because I thought I was typing in the login window, which was on top of everything with the cursor flashing in the password field.
fields.summary: SourceTree Bitbucket Login screen shows cursor flashing on password field even though it doesn't have focus.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a project with a submodule
 # The submodule should have some problem such that the remote can't be fetched
 # Change branches in the main project

*Observed:*

You get the expected error when SourceTree tries to fetch the submodule but the branch display panel on the left-hand side shows that the previously checked out branch is the current branch even though (via inspection with get CLI), the branch you tried to check out was checked out. 

So the checkout was successful, at least in that it became the current branch of the main repository, but the issue with the submodule seems to have circumvented update of the branch panel.

*Expected:*

 I would expect that what SourceTree indicates as the current branch would ALWAYS be the same as what the git command line (via "git status") says is the current branch
fields.summary: Failure to update screen after issue with submodule

fields.description: Please add alias 'Bitbucket' to SourceTree app to let us find SourceTree by typing 'Bitbucket' in Windows Start menu.
fields.summary: Add 'Bitbucket' alias to SourceTree app

fields.description:
When the file list is refreshed on the _File Status_ tab, the _Stage Selected_ button is disabled, even if there's a file selected.

I've seen three ways to reproduce this. 
 # Select an unstaged file. The _Stage Selected_ button is enabled.
 # Press F5. Now the _Stage Selected_ button is disabled.

Or
 # Select an unstaged file. The _Stage Selected_ button is enabled.
 # Change the file on disk.
 # The file list will automatically refresh and the _Stage Selected_ button will become disabled.

Or
 # Select an unstaged file that has multiple hunks.
 # Stage one of the hunks. Now the _Stage Selected_ button is disabled.
fields.summary: Stage Selected button is disabled when file list is refreshed

fields.description:
If the path to a file contains spaces, the first hunk (and only the first hunk) in the diff view shows the file name before the hunk number.

When the file name is shown, it's often so long that it flows over the _Stage hunk_ and _Discard hunk_ buttons, making those buttons completely useless.

Here are some screenshots:

_*File without spaces:*_

!without-spaces.png|thumbnail!

_*File with spaces:*_

_*!with-spaces.png|thumbnail!*_

_*File name flowing over the stage/discard buttons:*_

_*!hidden-buttons.png|thumbnail!*_

Obviously in these screenshots I've used a short file name and a very narrow diff view, but in reality, if the file is a few folders deep, the stage/discard buttons are completely hidden, making it impossible to stage or discard the hunk.
fields.summary: Diff view hunk show file name when it contains spaces and cuts off stage buttons

fields.description: The commit graph to the left of the commit message in the log view is not aligned properly, the 'dots' for each commit sit in between commit messages. This makes it very hard to see which branch a commit is on. If I could attach a screen shot, I would.
fields.summary: Commit graph is not aligned properly

fields.description:
The "Explorer" button in the top right corner should simply always open explorer to the top level directory of the repository.

Currently, the "Explorer" button only opens the folder of the currently selected file. The UI gives no indication of this except that if no file is selected, the button is disabled. This behavior is confusing and redundant. After using the button many times, when I was new to SourceTree, it was suddenly disabled and I didn't realise at first that it had a connection to the selection. If I want to show a particular file in explorer, I will right click on the file and use that specific option in the dropdown.

I believe it is a very common use case is to want to open the top level of the working directory quickly from within SourceTree. This feature is currently not really available. There is the "Actions -> Show In Explorer" action in the toolbar but that only does the desired behavior when nothing is selected. Often the visible file changes are buried somewhere deep in the work tree and then one needs to manually go up many levels and it's easy to go to far, bypassing the original intent.
fields.summary: "Explorer" button should always go to project root

fields.description:
When the window is maximized, the window cannot be dragged when you try to grab it at the very top pixel on screen. If you move the cursor down by one pixel, you can drag the window.

See the attached GIF for a demo. It's a bit hard to see what I'm doing because the cursor disappears from the GIF for some reason, but you can see when I click by the yellow circle that appears. The first three click-and-drags were trying to grab the window at the very top of the screen. The final click-and drag was grabbing the window lower down in the title bar.

!9041.gif!

All of the other issues around dragging a maximized window seem to have been fixed in the v3 beta. (y)
fields.summary: Cannot drag maximized window when grabbing from the very top of the screen

fields.description:
Number bubble on the push button on toolbar not updating after resetting commits back to stage.
h2. How to Reproduce
 # Commit change(s) from stage without pushing to origin
 # The push button on toolbar will show a number bubble of number of commits waiting to push to origin
 # Reset commit(s) using the terminal (e.g. git reset --soft HEAD^)
 # The commits are put back to stage, but the number bubble does not change
 # Restart sourcetree. The push button is now updated

Sourcetree is not consistently detecting changes being made to git via other sources outside its UI like the terminal.
fields.summary: Number bubble on the push button on toolbar not updating after resetting commits back to stage
Cannot pull repositories using sourcetree

closed and viewed notifications - showing repeat already

Every rununc aplllication - show 2 notification. I am closed tins- in runung program - showin repeat.

version - 2.6.10.1 

 

[link title|https://yadi.sk/i/YScWv9D53a2yeV]

I changed settings in Tools->Options->Authentication from OAuth to Basic, from Protocol SSH to HTTPS. Nothing makes any difference.  The Edit Hosting Account windows shows "Authentication OK" and I can log into Jira and Bitbucket web version just fine.  This worked fine yesterday, no settings where changed.   Upgraded to version 2.6.10.  Did not help
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps asking for the password and never connects

fields.description:
I am asked ten or more times per day to enter Bitbucket credentials via dialogue. Sometimes username is prepopulated, other times not.

I have tried wiping any Bitbucket and Git reference in _Windows Credential Manager_, reinstalling Git with and without _Git Credential Manager_, deleting and recreating accounts under Sourcetree's _Authentication_ tab, changing from _Embedded_ to _System_ Git and back again within Sourcetree's _Git_ tab. I also changed my Atlassian password twice.

Unable to login to sourcetree

Unable to login with my Atlassian account while installing the SourceTree1.8.3. But with same credentials able to login Atlassian site.

 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Sekhar Kasala

fields.description:
Hi I have installed Source tree registered with Atlassian and while configuring I selected both Git and  other one Mercian or something. it installed can see the Gui  then I generate the ssh key from the tool add it to my Github it is saying invalid SSH key I have tried several times it doesn't work for me.  I thought uninstall and re install with just selecting Git while configuring. However every time I reinstall it gives ,me previous setup back again.

I want need support with the SSH Key to communicate with Git Repo.
fields.summary: SSH Key  generated is not working for git

fields.description:
I have downloaded the newest version of sourcetree and am unable to run the installation. The window opens for a while and gives an error sourcetree has stopped working.  I have tried with previous versions but the problem remains. 

I checked the log which shows

ERROR [2018-08-03 11:47:23,937] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied

So I tried to manually implement the following setting in the user.config

<setting name="AutomaticallyCleanUpDictionaryFiles" serializeAs="String">
 <value>True</value>
 </setting>

 

The problem however, still remains, please suggest a solution
fields.summary: Unable to install sourcetree
When resolving conflict and accepting "mine", the confirmation window asks if I'm sure I want to accept "theirs".

fields.description: Button 'Commit' and checkbox 'Push changes immediately to ...' disappear if commit text comprises of many lines (i.e. the conflicts list in case of merge commit). To reproduce, type the text manually, one char per line is enough. After ~50 lines of text (FHD 96DPI screen) the button disappears.
fields.summary: Button 'Commit' disappears if commit text comprises of many lines

fields.description: Push and pull into Bitbucket Repository via OpenID (Authentication and authorization). As a part of out future architecture, we Need this Feature in order to push sourcetree as offcial Bitbucket Client in out firm. Please feel free to contact me for more Detail.
fields.summary: Push and pull into Bitbucket Repository via OpenID (Authentication and authorization).

fields.description:
The issue is that bookmark folders are not saved immediately without first closing the window.

*Steps to reproduce* -
 # Navigate to *Local repositories* page
 # Click *Add Folder*
 # Rename the "New Folder" to anything, "TEST" in this example
 # Click on another folder so that the new "TEST" folder label is no longer in edit mode
 # Click *Add* to link an existing Git repo to a folder
 # Notice that in the *Local Folder* dropdown, "TEST" is not an available option

A workaround for this issue is to perform another step between steps 4 and 5 - close the current tab after creating the new folder and then open a new tab.
fields.summary: Sourcetree folders do not get saved

fields.description: SourceTree apparently does not let us know when our *GIT Auth Token* expires. Kept asking me to log in again and again without letting me know that the token is expired. Went into Authentication setting in SourceTree and saw that the Token did not work and then *Refreshed OAuth Token*. After that Logged in into the dialog box that was popping up which made it work. Need better indication on expired tokens
fields.summary: No Indication On Expired Git OAuth Token
Remote Links Broken

fields.description:
In Atlassian Stash, in for example pull request diffs, you highlight both lines changed _and_ changes within those lines. This makes it a lot quicker and easier to see what's actually changed, especially when the changes are small.

In SourceTree you only highlight the full line, meaning I have to look for the actual change myself.

Please make the diff views in SourceTree highlight diffs like in Stash.

*Screenshots*

* SourceTree: https://i.imgur.com/32lEEJB.png
* Stash: https://i.imgur.com/VtGOruv.png
fields.summary: Highlight changes within lines, not just lines in Diffs

fields.description:
I am currently reviewing SourceTree + SemanticMerge for our Enterprise development team (30+ developers), but when I invoke the External diff, it returns an error dialog box with the following message:

*Item has already been added. Key in dictionary: 'home' key being added: 'HOME'*

 

I am able to run the SemanticMerge as a standalone tool successfully.
fields.summary: Item has already been added. 'home' key being added: 'HOME'

fields.description: We are not able to create a repository from Sourcetree itself. Also while going to create repository it doesn't list the existing projects on my remote accoun !image-2018-07-13-09-47-30-518.png! t.
fields.summary: Unable to create repository.

fields.description:
Just after a big windows update, Sourcetree stops working.

i tried uninstall + reinstall : KO

i tried reinstall an older version : KO

Watching the windows log events, i see some unhandled exception :
{code:java}
Application : SourceTree.exe
Version du Framework : v4.0.30319
Description : le processus a été arrêté en raison d'une exception non gérée.
Informations sur l'exception : System.Management.ManagementException
 à System.Management.ManagementException.ThrowWithExtendedInfo(System.Management.ManagementStatus)
 à System.Management.ManagementObjectCollection+ManagementObjectEnumerator.MoveNext()
 à SourceTree.Utils.WindowsOSHelper.GetWindowsVersion()
 à SourceTree.App..ctor()
 à SourceTree.App.Main(){code}
 and in another error just after :

 
{code:java}
Nom de l’application défaillante SourceTree.exe, version : 2.6.10.0, horodatage : 0x5b3cd3af
Nom du module défaillant : KERNELBASE.dll, version : 10.0.17134.165, horodatage : 0xb0bb231d

Could you fix this ?

fields.description:
Setup an instance with a column guide at {{72}} characters (and also ensuring a "fixed-width font for commit message" is checked) and observing that the guide is not properly aligned. With the following sample set:

{noformat}
--------------------------------------------------------------------70
---------------------------------------------------------------------71
----------------------------------------------------------------------72
-----------------------------------------------------------------------73
------------------------------------------------------------------------74
{noformat}

A guide set at 72 characters aligns at the 68 character mark (see attached). Adjusting the guide to 77 characters aligns the _around_ the 72 character mark (see attached).
fields.summary: column guide is incorrectly placed

fields.description:
On a Windows high-DPI display, when adjusting the column sizes on the Log/History tab in Sourcetree, the resize mouse cursor is extremely tiny and hard to see.  This doesn't occur in other apps.

https://imgur.com/a/GiVMiNw
fields.summary: Tiny mouse pointer on high-DPI screen

fields.description: I find myself wanting to copy and pate branch names often. It would be very useful if I could copy the branch name from the SourceTree interface. There doesn't seem to be a obvious place to do this now. Maybe allow the user to copy the branch name to the clipboard as a menu option when right clicking the branch?
fields.summary: Right click a branch and copy branch name to clipboard

fields.description: I have a lot of repositories. Since you've removed the old tree view for managing repositories, this has become a major headache. Since I hear you're not bringing it back (without reason?) it would be nice if some more functionality was included in what you are planning to support. Specifically, the information presented in the current "Local repositories" view is rather sparse. If I want to see which folder each is actually in on my local disk, I need to open each one individually. Same is true for remote urls. I'm sure there are other useful bits of information that could be added.
fields.summary: Details view for local repositories

fields.description: Currently, the commit description just a single-line; consequently, when there are several branch pointers for a given commit, as well as the commit message, they can't all be seen without repetitively resizing the line.  A better solution might be to have a maximum of 2 (or a configurable number) of lines in the description, wrapping the branch pointers and commit message accordingly.
fields.summary: Multi-line display of description line in history view

fields.description:
(I'm sorry to request this feature, because I don't know it's a limitation of SourceTree or git.)

Most of all, I want merge current brance to other brance without changing working brance to the other one.

It issue is related with SRCTREEWIN-9010 which is also created by me.

If these requets are implemented, my (and all other user's maybe) work flow will greatly improved.

 

For example, when I'm working with 'AddingFeature' branch and a feature is implemented with several commits, I want to merge it to 'Main' branch with my own commit message without changing working branch to Main branch.

After the merging, I can continuously work in 'AddingFeature' branch without changing working branch if there is no conflict.

 

I this workflow, I don't need to change working branch, so it will save lots of time if I added so many resources for a feature which can take so many time to change brance, because my dev environment may need to re-compile whenever I change working branch.

 

Generally, if any two branches (or any two commits) can be merged regardless of my working branch, it will be best for me.

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Merge two brances regardress of current brance

fields.description:
Sometimes I want to make commit only for certain kind of files.

So I need to filter them with regular expression.

 

Forexample, when I want to stage all *.c files under /lib directory of my project,

it will be greate if I can filter files with regular expression like:

^lib/.*\.c$

 

I need only for unstaged files but it will be better if I can filter for staged ones.
fields.summary: Filter unstaged filepath and filename with regular expression

fields.description:
SourceTree can make a seperated commit even if fast-forward(FF) if possible.

If I do that, SourceTree makes a commit with pre-defined commit message.

 

But I want to write my own commit message, so I want be given a chance to change the commit message before making commit.
fields.summary: Merging brances without commit even though fast-forward is possible

fields.description:
Sorry that I wrote all bugs and improvements here, I have a lot of work to do also SourceTree eating my time already. Those are all I noted in time:
 * bug: FileStatus/popup menu/log selected is grayed (don't work) only after search (all items) only for view: flat list(multiple colums), it works only view: flat list(single column), neither so all time
 * ~~ improvement: File Status/View: Tree view don't collapse at searching in all files, here I don't know, it's difficult to retail parent folder correctly for all filtered
 * ~ improvement: File Status/ after search and get a few files, then any change of view: sorted by (filename, path // reversed .. status) or view: (flat list simple, multiple, treee view) reset serch result and get all files...
 *  bug: on merge (without commit imediatelly ) it continously flicking (after second ) and cannot press commit button .. also it continously timer replace commit text, making impossible to change it
 * bug: file log: date column too thin and actually all time ... it also neither save window properties
 * bug: click-ul on a remote branch (from file log.. and others which positioning in log tree graph: sometimes don't position correctly (when too old, not actually loaded-fetched)
 * bug: ..graph also loose actual selected item index when resizing graph column (to see older commits wich was too much that branches that time, too wide than actual width of column)
 * bug: Log/History: also resize between log tree graph and commit info/files/internal diff don't work sometimes (because file log or another reason) then work again
 * ~ improvement: FileStatus/Commit Options/ammend lastest commit/replace commit text: .. choosing: no... doesn't check neither amend lastest commit. it is normal? I wan't only put entire new text (old not needed)... that text I see independently than commit option: amend lastest commit
 *  improvement: performance: when in file status/all filese (also automatically set from pending files when search), to not autorefresh entire list on activate form(focus) (we have thousands of files and when search and leave it so, then: after activate it back, as window, it refresh a log of time).
 * improvement: after of a lot of merges {color:#172b4d}from 200M{color} it consumes a lot of RAM, over 1.3 GB.

Thank you a lot and sorry again :(
fields.summary: Log selected file grayed on view multiple columns, more bugs and few improvements

fields.description:
We use Bitbucket Server linked to our AD for authentication.  AD enforces password changes every so often.  have had issues before and solved by deleting passwords, but mainly i use SSH for git connections.  however,
 * wanted to clone a new repo and went to pick via the "remote account" link. 
 * Showed as not authenticated.
 * Right-click and edit account to get to the _Edit hosting Account_ window
 * Click _Refresh password_
 * Enter new password.  Authentication fails

I tried multiple times.  never worked.  Calling the URL ([https://our.bitbucket.domain/rest/api/1.0/users)] it said it was trying, using curl with -u worked fine. 

 

If I deleted the hosting account and re-created it worked, but it would not update the password on an existing hosting account.

 

Using version 2.6.10 (not available as "Affects version"?) on Windows 10
fields.summary: Cannot update password for hosting accounts

fields.description: When installing Sourcetree the shortcut to Git Terminal (bash) is not created. Please create it. It should open to Project folder or $home/~ folder.
fields.summary: Ad Start menu link to Terminal

fields.description: Please add buttons Terminal and Explorer on New tab. When clicked they should open at or show Project folder set in Options. Enable the Show in Explorer menu item under Actions when case New tab is open as well.
fields.summary: Terminal and Explorer button on New tab

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Click inside the commit textbox on the 'File Status' tab
# Click the 'Push' button on the toolbar
# Press enter

*What I expect to happen:* Initiate a git push

*What actually happens:* A newline is added to the commit message

At that point I remember that Ctrl-Alt-Enter is the hotkey that initiates the push from this dialog.

Some time later I come back to the commit message textbox, see the extra newline, and curse. Only softly though.
fields.summary: Keyboard focus stays on commit message when push dialog is opened

fields.description:
The Diff window in Sourcetree doesn't have its own scrollbar, and the current implementation with a scrollbar at the bottom of each hunk is not user friendly at all, as you have to scroll to the bottom of the hunk, move the scrollbar, then scroll back up to the part of the text you want to see.  There have been dozens of Horizontal Scrollbar bug reports, so this is definitely something that needs improvement.

*Suggestion:*

Please move the scrollbar to the scrollview itself, instead each of the hunks, so it will ALWAYS be accessible without having to scroll down and back up.  Also, if you make the scrollbar's scroll-distance equal to the longest window of all of the hunks being displayed, then a single scrollbar can work for everything.  This would be a much nicer user experience.

Thanks for all the work that has gone into Sourcetree.  It has a much cleaner interface than Git Extensions by far.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scrollbar should be at bottom of scrollview, not bottom of content in scrollview

fields.description:
Developers often want to create empty branches. They can't create it using GUI, because SourceTree can create branch only from working copy parent or specified commit.

To create empty branch, you have to go to terminal and execute:

 
{code:java}
git checkout --orphan branchname

git rm -rf .
{code}
 

add files

 
{code:java}
git add .

git commit -m "commit message"

git push -u origin branchname
{code}
 

Only after that you may see the new branch on GUI.

Please, add the feature for creating new empty (without parent) branches on GUI.
fields.summary: Creating new empty (without parent) branch on GUI

fields.description:
When using High Contrast Black color theme SourceTree ignores windows system colors. Some backgrounds are still white. Labels in dialogs are drawn with black on black. So it's impossible to use SourceTree at this theme.

!image-2018-07-20-10-40-46-231.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't support High Contrast Black theme
GUI 界面因为 commit 内容过多而卡死

fields.description:
Basically I have the same bug someone had a while ago:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1781

 

Git can't add super long filenames and deletes them instead(!) of adding.

This seems to be a serious bug, I just lost files, because every file above a certain name length Sourcetree "believes" it was deleted after you modified it and removes it after commit.

SUPER annoying

Steps:
 * add a file with a super long filename which causes the bug, add via command line.
 * modify file(s),
 * add in Sourcetree and commit. it will get deleted/be shown as removed

 

I just modified files and as always Sourcetree wants me to add them:

Screenshot:

[https://imgur.com/oglCXY2]

Directly(!) after adding the files, one gets removed from my workspace, only chance to get it back was the local history (thank god!)

Screenshot:

[https://imgur.com/x9TdwJZ]

 

My git version : 2.18.0.windows.1

Sourcetree : 2.6.10  

OS: Windows 10 Enterprise 64bit

 

I can add and commit the same files with git bash no problem, one change in these files and they are deleted after "git add ."
fields.summary: fatal pathspec: '<longfilename>' did not match any files" error when adding file, then file gets deleted

fields.description:
It would be really nice if SourceTree had an optional console view at the bottom of the application window with an adjustable height and light text on dark background.  It would show output from every Git operation that is performed, even 'git add' or 'git show'.  It would also have configurable levels of verbosity.

I think this would help people learn what is going on behind the scenes, and also for experienced users to learn new Git commands.

 

Mercurial support is optional.
fields.summary: Console window

fields.description:
Sourcetree does not support showing merge commits in a special way. 
 [http://haacked.com/archive/2014/02/21/reviewing-merge-commits/]

We can only view complete diff compared to both parents, not what changes the merge commit introduced itself over the two parents. Reading all of it would mean to review it a second time.

The point is that when a merge has conflicts, only those conflict resolution changes need further review, or might be interesting otherwise. Automatic, unchanged merges have already been reviewed and should be just fine.

TortoiseGit already has this feature to "Show extra changes after merge" [https://gitlab.com/tortoisegit/tortoisegit/issues/2469 |https://gitlab.com/tortoisegit/tortoisegit/issues/2469]

We can use CLI to view these extra changes using:
 * git show <hash>
 * git diff-tree --cc <hash>

SourceTree should also provide this feature.
fields.summary: Support reviewing merge commits (git show <merge-commit-hash>)

fields.description:
By default, Git repositories reside inside the working tree. This behavior is controlled by the environment variable *GIT_DIR*, which defaults to *./.git* 

SourceTree does not acknowledge this environment variable, and so it cannot open repositories created with alternative *GIT_DIR*.

To reproduce:
 * Set environment variable *GIT_DIR* to anything else, say *./.git_other*
 * Open SourceTree, create a Git repository using *File -> Create/New -> Create* .
 * Note that Git creates a new repository at the location you specify using the *.git_other* name
 * Attempt to add the new repository in SourceTree, note that it cannot be opened.

SourceTree reports "This is not a valid working copy path".
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores GIT_DIR environment variable

fields.description:
When starting up SourceTree, the main window sometimes has the smallest possible size. This happens approximately 20-40% of the times I start it up, so the problem is sporadic.

Expected behavior: The main window should have the same size every time I start up SourceTree.

I have a suspicion that this happens if SourceTree is running while Windows shuts down. I will keep an eye out for this and report further.
fields.summary: Main window size is forgotten (case put on hold for now)

fields.description:

fields.summary: Doesn't start after Installation
Broken URL for Bitbucket Server

fields.description: When I'm on a branch and trying to merge in another branch, sometimes I'll click the merge button from the top toolbar, and even after the commit history tree finishes loading, it will constantly reload, making scrolling down to pick a commit impossible, and making the merge impossible to complete from this view. This means I have to go to the terminal to perform the merge, which is less than ideal
fields.summary: Sourcetree constantly refreshes commit history in merge view

fields.description: When clicking on commit to commit files to GIT the screen is frozen and it isn't possible to go forward
fields.summary: Screen is frozen while commiting

fields.description: Unable to authenticate with Bitbucket via either OAuth or Basic authentication when attempting to fetch against an existing repo. Sourcetree opens multiple authentication prompts even though account is showing as OAuth authenticated. Can browse the remote repository and clone although Checking source... takes a while.
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud authentication fails

fields.description:
Hi!

We have parents list at commit info panel. All hashes coloured with standard link colour (blue),

Also we have commits graph. There are two inlet edges on each commit - all with different colour.

 

If colours of parent commits on info panel were same as colours of coresponding edges on graph, we could navigate between them more easily.
fields.summary: Make commit parents colours coresponding to edges colors

fields.description:
Pulling and pushing no longer works in 2.6.9. It worked fine in 2.6.6.

 

See screenshot:

!https://i.imgur.com/BxtJPjK.png!

 

And yes, pulling and pushing works fine on the command prompt.
fields.summary: REGRESSION: Cannot push or pull since 2.6.9

fields.description:
I'm not focused on Sourcetree, yet process explorer tell me that sourcetree's child git processes are eating nearly 100% of the cpu on all cores (An i7 6700K is 4-core with hyperthreading, so 8 logical cores). I do have an image of this, but i cant figure out how to add to the ticket.

 

I have 6 repo tabs, and 2 submodule repo tabs open (both submodules are the same repo attached to different parent repos), one of the main repos is very binary-file-heavy with images and music, and most of the main repos have 30+ branches.

It seems very similair to this issue from the Mac version as when i collapse the branch lists it seems to let up. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1064
fields.summary: Near 100% CPU usage while in background

fields.description: !https://i.imgur.com/jvCSn0Z.png!
fields.summary: Commit Comment Over Window Boundary when text long

fields.description:
During initial installation, registering a Bitbucket Server account fails. This renders the app useless as it cannot be installed and be connected to our hosted Bitbucket server. I receive the following error:

 
{code:java}
ERROR [2018-07-11 10:44:10,558] [1] [SourceTree.Exceptions.RemoteHostException] [.ctor] - Insufficient authentication credentials
ERROR [2018-07-11 10:44:10,561] [1] [SourceTree.Exceptions.RemoteHostException] [.ctor] - Failed to check login for user [mock_user]
{code}
Previous versions of Source Tree have worked. 

 

Thanks,

 

--Chris
fields.summary: cannot login into local bitbucket server
Manipulation with bookmarks outside of Sourcetree

fields.description: I had an account on bitbucket and the first time I used sourcetree I set this account as default. I left the company where I worked and had to modify the default account, but the system does not give this option. Now, every time I need to do something, it asks for my authentication ... even when I change something with the sourcetree open ... then he asks for my authentication that is appearing cascade if I do not pay attention. So when I need to upload the project, I need at least one open authentication window to fill in, and then the one that the system requests at the time of the pull ... quite tiring, but the system is very good.
fields.summary: Users Authentication on windows dont permit add new users.

fields.description:
There are several usability issues with the "Git-LFS not supported" notification in the UI (where it also informs of new versions of SourceTree):
 * There's no option to dismiss it - I don't need Git-LFS support, so it not being supported is intentional, yet the notification is permanent. (Technically it can be dismissed, but it comes back after app restart.)
 * The subtext indicates that I need to update the version of Git I'm using, when in fact I'm using a version that does support Git-LFS but have opted not to install that component, which is an install time option on Git for Windows.
fields.summary: There should be a way to disable Git-LFS notification

fields.description:
Hi Support,

2.6.9.0 Enterprise edition prompts for upgrading git-lfs with an yellow flag in the title bar.

A part from that it is completely not acceptable in enterprise for users to use/download/install tools that are not verified by the company and rolled out to the by infrastructure teams, it is prompting the user even if there is "Don't prompt about the new Sourcetree installation." setlled in the options. 

(One would think, that this option "don't prompt..." will disappear from the enterprise version, as it is usually prohibited to corporate employees  to install software by them selves. One would also think that such option (being disappeared and unchangeable default)will also affect prompts for git-lfs, git and other vcs tools.)

Please fix it.

Best Regards,
Adam Dedek
CommerzSystems / Commerzbank
fields.summary: 2.6.9.0 Enterprise Edition prompts for upgrades of git-lfs

fields.description:
1) When merging branches, right-click a file with conflicts

2) Selecting Resolve Conflicts | Launch External Merge

Nothing happens. This worked in SourceTree 2.5.x.  SourceTree still launches BeyondCompare successfully for Diff. 

Lack of interactive merging is a significant loss of functionality.
fields.summary: External Merge not launching

fields.description:
In the "New Tab" window, it would be very helpful if the working copy file path of each repository in the local repository list was displayed.

Quite often one has to checkout multiple working copies of the same repository, because it is used as a submodule in various projects. In that case it is impossible to distinguish between the different working copies without being able to see the local file path.

Please display the file path for each item in the local repositories list, for example above or underneath the item's branch label.
fields.summary: Display working copy file path in Local Repositories list in the "New Tab" window

fields.description:
On right-click at a repository:
 * change 'Open' to 'Open here' (or 'Open in this tab'  or likewise)
 * and add an extra option 'Open in new tab'.

This new option should open the repository in a new tab AND make that new tab active.

 

In menu  Tools > Options > General   add a setting:
 * Make 'Open in new tab' default on double-click

 

I think this is a simple change that would improve Tab-management a lot, because then I can double-click repositories and get them in extra Tab's and keep the repositories overview in the first Tab.
fields.summary: Option to open repository in new Tab

fields.description:
Select a repo then go to "file status", search for a file with the search edit at top right of screen. Right click on file and select "log selected". Close the log selected screen.

Now use the search edit again to locate a different set of files. Right click on one of those file and "log selected" is greyed out (it shouldnt be)

Restart close and restart sourcetree, then search for the same file that had "log selected" greyed out, and now its available.
fields.summary: Log Selected fails when used on different files

fields.description:
When i work with more of changed files after a while I stop seeing content of changed files. See attached printscreen and look for red number 2 and 3 and you will know what I mean.

 

Images: https://imgur.com/a/xj83Lv9

 

Steps:
 # Open project with more changed files.
 # Select couple of files (3-5) in tree "Unstaged files" and click on "Stage selected"
 # Click on another 1 file in tree and click on "Stage selected" (only 1 file)
 # When you will repeat step 3 couple of times, maybe 3 times or so (soemtimes more sometimes less) then you will stop seeing content in right view ("hunk view"?) - see attached printscreen and look for red number 3.
 # This was happening in older version of ST and back then helps when I have changed options "Max file count" (see printscreen - red number 4)
 # Now in version 2.6.10 (Windows) it is back.

 

Only restart of application helps but you have to do it very often.
fields.summary: Wrong detection of changes in files - nothing is displayed in right panel view

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in Sourcetree for Windows via filenames in Mercurial repositories. An attacker with permission to commit to a Mercurial repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows before version 2.6.9 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 2.6.9 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] .

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/4erXO].
fields.summary: Argument injection via Mercurial repository filenames - CVE-2018-13386

fields.description:
The embedded version of Git used in Sourcetree for Windows was vulnerable to CVE-2018-11235. An attacker can exploit this issue if they can commit to a Git repository linked in Sourcetree for Windows that has been recursively cloned or if a user interacts with a submodule. This allows them to execute arbitrary code on systems running a vulnerable version of Sourcetree for Windows.

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Sourcetree for Windows from 0.5.1.0 before 2.6.7 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for Windows to version 2.6.9 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/] .

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/4erXO].
fields.summary: Git submodules vulnerability - CVE-2018-11235

fields.description:
I use dark Gmail, dark IntelliJ IDEA, dark browser, everything is dark except SourceTree.

The white user interface kills my eyes. Can we have an option for a dark theme?
fields.summary: Implement a dark theme/skin
Issue with Configuring Sourcetree 2.6.9

fields.description: Add possibility of searching and "go to line" functionality to annotation window.
fields.summary: Search and "Go to line" in annotation window

fields.description:
When opening sourcetree it only shows a black screen. 

Right mouse options are available.

!image-2018-07-02-16-04-12-733.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree opens in all black

fields.description:
In the Tools/Option/Git/ window, the embedded button is disabled and the system button is highlighted. But I do not have git installed. SourceTree is using git some were. If I click the System button, it will ask me where the git.exe is located. The default folder does not contain it. I did a search and found 2 copies of it in Visual Studio but I am not using git in Visual Studio.
SourceTree is notifying me that there is a new version of git. I have updated the embedded version but SourceTree is not using it.
How can I get SourceTree to use the embedded version?
fields.summary: git embedded button is disabled

fields.description:
The startup time for SourceTree is very slow, usually 45+ sec. There's a brief "flash" of the SourceTree logo dialog then the screen goes blank. Subsequently, there a few quick displays of some kind of dialog windows but they aren't displayed long enough to read them.

The app should display a "loading" dialog immediately after being launched which stays displayed until the full UI is loaded. In addition, the startup time needs to be reduced to no more than 10-15 sec. It would be better to display the full UI, then have a loading message while the repository data is being loaded.
fields.summary: Startup is very slooooow, 45-60 sec

fields.description:
Actual:
 # Perform a commit. (I'm using a git repository.)
 # The "File Status" view then shows "Nothing to commit".
 # In order to get back to the previous view, I click on the current branch in the list of branches. (See workaround below, I now now there's a better way!)
 # The following can be observed happening quickly:
 ## It shows the Log / History tab with the most recent commit selected
 with its details visible below.
 ## An overlay appears stating it's Loading 300 commits to reach a particular (seemingly random) commit.
 ## The load finishes then:
 ### The list of commits shows nothing selected.
 ### The commit details area is blank (grey).
 # Then, whenever I select a commit from the history it shows "Displaying all changes between" message, showing another commit is also selected.
 # Whenever I click a different commit, the visible selection changes, but there is still a hidden commit selected.
 # I then CTRL-Click on my visible commit to unselect it and now see the preview of the mystery commit from months ago.

Expected

I don't expect anything to become automatically selected.

Workaround:

In documenting this, I've realized I should just click the "Log / History" tab after committing.

Still, it is an odd behaviour that kept catching me out because of my strange navigation habits. This quirk is a recent new behaviour.
fields.summary: After commit, selecting current branch selects hidden list item

fields.description: My SourceTree crashes every time I open the program. This happens specifically every time I click on the Graph/Description window within the Log/History tab. This occurs regardless of the repository that I use. I have tried to remove all files and reinstall to see if there was any corrupt file but this did not solve the issue. Also I tried to download many different versions but this did not solve the issue either.
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps crashing when I try to open it

fields.description:
After experimenting with Custom Actions, I noticed, that my created actions are not updated in the right-click menu when selecting files in the File Status view.

Not all actions were visible and when running one of the available actions they had an old behaviour I just had changed.

The top menu Actions --> Custom Actions was up-to-date.
fields.summary: Custom Action Menu entry  not updated.

fields.description:
I'm trying to sourcetree 2.6.9 on windows to connect to a Bitbucket server.

Usernames in this instance are equal to their email addresses.

I'm getting error 'User xxxx does not exist' when i try to authenticate using HTTPS.

It's working fine if i create a user whose username is just firstname.lastname. Having @domain.com in the username seems to be the problem.
fields.summary: User not found when username contains @

fields.description:
# SourceTree is windowed or full screen on left monitor #1.
 # Click on title bar and drag.  If SourceTree was previously full screen, the window is displayed in the wrong location relative to the mouse.
 # Drag the mouse to the top of middle monitor #2 or right monitor #3, until windows 10 display animation to go full screen on the selected monitor.
 # Let go of the mouse button.  The SourceTree window goes full screen on the selected monitor, however the window is 100% black.
 # To recover, must close and reopen the application.

This only occurs when dragging from the left monitor, and when going to full screen on the other monitors.
fields.summary: UI turns black when dragging from monitor left of the main monitor.

fields.description:
Sourcetree states that authentication to a repository has failed. 

Apparently, there is no other way to solve this, than to delete the passwd file located in 
C:\Users\\{Username}\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree

This will make Sourcetree prompt for a password. 

However, the username is autofilled incorrectly, and is greyed out so it cannot be changed.
fields.summary: Authentication fails

fields.description:
When I want to change anything (Branch, Commit,...) on my git submodules, I usually double click on the submodule in SourceTree. Then a new Tab opens with the submodule repo. The problem is, that you can not see, that the new tab is the submodule and not any other repository.

Ideas:
 # Color the main repository and the submodule tab in a different color than the other opened tabs so the connection is clear.
 # Show a "Superproject Pointer" in the submodule view like eg Tortoise Git is doing it
fields.summary: Mark Submodule Tabs as such

fields.description:
As soon as you have enough commits in your Log/History a scrollbar appears.
But, this scrollbar is *on top* of the grid (instead of to the side of the grid); this means that the last 1-2 characters of the commit hash fall behind the scrollbar.
fields.summary: Scrollbar on top of commithash

fields.description:
Perform a merge with conflicted files.

Open the external merge tool.

This created some extra files in directory.

Close merge tool (if it opens at all)

Select extra files

Right Click, select 'Remove'

Wonder why unselected files are included in the 'Confirm' dialogue box.

!image-2018-06-26-14-19-48-358.png!
fields.summary: Remove file option includes (and therefore deletes) unselected files

fields.description:
While a context menu is showing, singleclicking the titlebar will restore/maximize the window. This should only happen on doubleclick.

 

Windows handles clicks & doubleclicks on the titlebar by default. Why rewrite that?
fields.summary: Singleclick can maximize/restore

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team, 

:-) 

As I was writing about our issues with remote tab [SRCTREEWIN-8845|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-8845] where account manager operations were included, I spotted as I was trying to help the remote tab to perform that an credentials prompt was provided to me. (y)

It should be noted that a part of the fact it didn't popped up and it stood standing ashamed somewhere in the behind of other windows it emerged on very much arbitrary time when I was not concerning this functionality any longer, my impression was it emerged with a very long delay. (n)

I was very much trying to persuade the account manager to behave in numerous ways.... 

First of all it seemed to me that it is starting to do at least something (have some minimal reactions to my actions) where there are more then one accounts defined. (on)

I was really angry with the behaviour of the (first experience) setup account configuration where there it is a must to click login (pressing enter doesn't do the same thing and) when the credentials prompt (in sourcetree's widget) comes up (the user name is missing there and even if I fill it) after passing it my password as well it replies with "user not found" / "username missing" warning and it fails. (n) (n)
This behavior is presented when I reach the account manager / credentials prompt by other means as well. :(

It also doesn't distinguishes between the same accounts entered with more or less same serverurl ... (n)
as there are multiple entries of servername:port as well as username@servername:port which refers to a same account. 

There is also an account starting with "Git:" which I assume is the master account I have used when prompted by first experience setup.

All of the accounts presented in the accounts tab / account manager window are possible to edit / delete or set as default, but none of there options doesn't make sourcetree to reconsider the accounts a part of one of them being changed to default. (n)

Sourcetree also doesn't care if I let it store the passwords or not, it doesn't use those passwords as it doesn't reload the remote tab when trying to reach the server's repositories (not yet cloned). (n)

There is a slight chance that switching between accounts and trying to switch to remote tab or refresh its contents with the button that a credentials prompt in window widget will be displayed where there is a chance to issue a password which will be used on next refresh button press. (Y)

There is also a chance (not being so slight unfortunately) that sourcetree will crash during the accounts mengling which results in some corruption of the profile related files which in turn prohibits sourcetree to start at all. :(

It is also possible to achieve the profile corruption by removing the "Git:" tagged account which will again prohibits sourcetree from starting up. (occurred only once)

There is also second profile files corruption variant when user tries to install and use sourcetree EE on several client machines on the same network.
After such attempt is made the sourcetree  profile is corrupted in the way that the first experience setup will appear everytime sourcetree is run. Second variant of the corruption again prohibits sourcetree from starting at all everagain on the same client machine unless the profile files are completely removed.  

Thank you very much for your support.
Best Regards,

Adam Dedek
Commerzsystems
fields.summary: SourceTree EE accounts manager unable to reuse stored password

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team, 

We got hour hands on your SourceTree 2.5.5 Enterprise edition and it heals most of our pain points reported in [SRCTREEWIN-8362|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-8362]

We haven't had opportunity to go true all its functions and test them. But as we were testing the absolute basics before providing package to our users we have found that  the Remote tab doesn't behave as we think it should be ... 

While it is possible to reach the accounts menu thru various paths and adding an account basically works. It also seems that the "set as default" button somehow works and is able to switch between the accounts.
(The account management it self has its own issues - I will report in other issue)

However the remote tab never works properly and is not able to display nor freely accessible repositories at bitbucket server nor the repositories my account is able to access. 

It sometimes displays one repository of many, where it is completely arbitrary selection which repo is displayed and there is noting to do about it.
Sometimes it displays a lot of repositories of again very much arbitrary selection where there is also "load more" option displayed under the list and pressing that button sometimes adds more entries and sometimes it doesn't. 

On top of it all regardless the scenario it had went thru there is a "clone" button which is impossible to press (and trigger it to start cloning the repository).

Only way to clone a repository with sourcetree for us is to either define all manually or go to bitbucket server ui and press "Clone in SourceTree" button there which works. 

Testing the behavior earlier I was provided with I was provided with number of popup windows mentioning exceptions or warnings, but I 'm not able to see / find / reach them again. 

Is it possible to turn on somewhat debug mode in sourcetree? 

Is it for example possible to redirect all the messages and exceptions to some file to see where t is struggling and when ? 

As I was going thru it to confirm the issues are valid and started to fill this ticket form, getting back to sourcetree window on arbitrary occassions clicking here and there along writing the issue text I spotted sourcetree provided me with credentials prompt in an window's widget. When I was able to provide credentials there and clicked refresh several times it was able to load some repositories then. 
(seems that the account manager also cannot reuse the stored password!)

Best Regards,
Adam Dedek
Commerzsystems
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.5.5 EE Remote tab and accounts doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
The whitespace differences do not appear properly in the diff windows. This could be the case when adding/deleting tabs or spaces.

It is impossible to know what is the actual change just by looking at them and this would be very helpful sometimes, in order to know whether to reject or not the change.
fields.summary: Add an option to show actual whitespace characters in the diff window
not receiving repository list from bitbucket
nothing vissible by using windows contrast theme

fields.description: Sometimes when I go to commit code the "Push changes immediately to" checkbox is either grayed out and I cannot get it to become enable again, or it flickers. When its flickering, it becomes a game of me trying to click the checkbox when its enable so that I can commit code. It gets very frustrating after a while.
fields.summary: Flickering (or disabled) push changes immediately to checkbox

fields.description:
I make changes on my remote branches using IDE and I am able to see the Uncommitted changes in the bottom left window of Unstaged files.

Upon clicking on the changed files, I see the changes I have made in pink and green lines on the right bottom window.  But I would like to use external diff to be able to see the diffs between the current changes and the previous version. 

I downloaded Beyond Compare 3, WinMerge and AraxisMerge to try and see if at least one external diff tool works with sourceTree. I right click the changed file and choose external diff and nothing happens. 

I also tried hitting the gear icon on the right bottom window and choosing external diff. 

I have tried all kinds of settings to make the external diff work and made sure the diff path is pointing to the diff tool in the tools options. I even tried switching from Embedded git version to system. 

The issue is not with the diff tools as I am able to open the diff files just fine from the explorer or on its own. 

Any help to resolve this issue is greatly appreciated as it is extremely frustrating to not be able to diff it directly from sourceTree.
fields.summary: No External Diff tools work from Source tree when right clicked
